question: How many ways can the letters of the word 'MATH' be arranged?
A box contains 6 red balls and 4 blue balls. In how many ways can 3 balls be chosen?
How many ways can a committee of 4 people be formed from a group of 8 people?
A student needs to answer 3 out of 5 questions in an exam. How many ways can the student choose the questions?
In how many ways can 5 different books be arranged on a shelf?
A password consists of 3 different letters chosen from A, B, C, D, E. How many such passwords can be formed?
A school has 6 boys and 4 girls. A team of 3 students is to be selected. How many ways can this be done?
How many ways can the letters of the word 'SUCCESS' be arranged?
How many different 4-digit numbers can be formed using the digits 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 without repetition?
How many different words can be formed from the letters of the word 'MISSISSIPPI'?
In how many ways can the letters of the word 'ALGORITHM' be arranged so that all vowels always come together?
From 7 men and 6 women, a committee of 5 is to be formed. How many ways can it be formed with at least 3 women?
How many 4-digit numbers can be formed from digits 1 to 9 such that digits are distinct and number is even?
How many permutations of the word 'INDEPENDENT' have all E's together?
From a group of 10 people, how many ways can 4 of them sit in a row?
How many 5-digit numbers can be formed using digits 0–9, without repetition and starting with non-zero?
How many ways can 5 boys and 5 girls be seated in a row such that no two girls sit together?
In how many ways can 8 people be seated around a circular table such that two specific persons must not sit together?
From the digits 1 to 7, how many 3-digit odd numbers can be formed without repetition?
How many ways can 3 students be arranged in a row?
If we have 10 people and 4 chairs, what are the number of ways to seat them?
In how many ways can we form a 5 lettered word? No repetition, starting with ‘a’ and ending with ‘z’.
In how many ways a committee consisting of 4 men and 2 women, can be chosen from 6 men and 5 women?
In how many ways a committee consisting of 5 men and 3 women, can be chosen from 9 men and 12 women?
How many ways can the letters of the word 'CONTINENTAL' be arranged?
